basics.name: Anuprovo Debnath
basics.label: Third-year Undergraduate Student (BS–MS)
basics.summary: Third-year undergraduate at IISER Kolkata with strong interests in plasma physics, nuclear fusion, and computational physics. Actively engaged in simulation, spectroscopy-based plasma diagnostics, and scientific computing.

education.institution: Indian Institute of Science Education and Research, Kolkata

projects.name: Evaluating Plasma Parameters from a Typical LIBS Plasma
projects.summary: Python-based framework to extract electron temperature (Te) and density (ne) from LIBS plasmas using Boltzmann plots, Saha–Boltzmann analysis, and Stark broadening with NIST spectral data. Extended with ML-based improvements and self-absorption modeling.

projects.name: Relativistic Accretion Disk Simulation
projects.summary: Simulation of accretion disks around black holes in relativistic frameworks, following classical and relativistic fluid dynamics formulations.

projects.name: Thermodynamics Reading Project
projects.summary: Reading project on thermodynamics and statistical mechanics based on 'A Treatise on Heat' by M.N. Saha and B.N. Srivastava.

projects.name: Hobbyist Compute Cluster (Slashdot)
projects.summary: Setting up a Proxmox + Kubernetes-based compute cluster using refurbished PCs to allow students to experiment without affecting production systems.

experience.summary: Led technical and organizational initiatives including compute infrastructure and national-level events.
Organized an IBM-sponsored national quantum computing workshop using Qiskit.

awards.title: DST INSPIRE Scholarship
awards.summary: Awarded for ranking in the top 1% of ISC examination.
